00034 /** @file builtins-c.c
00035     @brief Standard library function implementations written in C.
00036 
00037     This file provides C implementations of various functions that can be
00038     called from ispc programs; in other words, this file is *not* linked
00039     into the ispc compiler executable, but rather provides functions that
00040     can be compiled into ispc programs.
00041 
00042     When the ispc compiler is built, this file is compiled with clang to
00043     generate LLVM bitcode.  This bitcode is later linked in to the program
00044     being compiled by the DefineStdlib() function.  The first way to access
00045     definitions from this file is by asking for them name from the
00046     llvm::Module's' symbol table (e.g. as the PrintStmt implementation does
00047     with __do_print() below.  Alternatively, if a function defined in this
00048     file has a signature that can be mapped back to ispc types by the
00049     lLLVMTypeToIspcType() function, then its declaration will be made
00050     available to ispc programs at compile time automatically.
00051   */
00052 
00053 
00054 #ifndef _MSC_VER
00055 #include <unistd.h>
00056 #endif // !_MSC_VER
00057 
00058 #include <stdint.h>
00059 #include <stdio.h>
00060 #include <stdlib.h>
00061 #include <stdarg.h>
00062 
00063 typedef int Bool;
00064 
00065 #define PRINT_SCALAR(fmt, type)  \
00066     printf(fmt, *((type *)ptr)); \
00067     break
00068 
00069 #define PRINT_VECTOR(fmt, type)                                         \
00070     putchar('[');                                                       \
00071     for (int i = 0; i < width; ++i) {                                   \
00072         /* only print the value if the current lane is executing */     \
00073         if (mask & (1<<i))                                              \
00074             printf(fmt, ((type *)ptr)[i]);                              \
00075         else                                                            \
00076             printf("((" fmt "))", ((type *)ptr)[i]);                    \
00077         putchar(i != width-1 ? ',' : ']');                              \
00078     }                                                                   \
00079     break
00080 
00081 /** This function is called by PrintStmt to do the work of printing values
00082     from ispc programs.  Note that the function signature here must match
00083     the parameters that PrintStmt::EmitCode() generates.
00084 
00085     @param format  Print format string
00086     @param types   Encoded types of the values being printed.
00087                    (See lEncodeType()). 
00088     @param width   Vector width of the compilation target
00089     @param mask    Current lane mask when the print statemnt is called
00090     @param args    Array of pointers to the values to be printed
00091  */
00092 void __do_print(const char *format, const char *types, int width, int mask, 
00093                 void **args) {
00094     if (mask == 0) 
00095         return;
00096 
00097     int argCount = 0;
00098     while (*format) {
00099         // Format strings are just single percent signs.
00100         if (*format != '%')
00101             putchar(*format);
00102         else {
00103             if (*types) {
00104                 void *ptr = args[argCount++];
00105                 // Based on the encoding in the types string, cast the
00106                 // value appropriately and print it with a reasonable
00107                 // printf() formatting string.
00108                 switch (*types) {
00109                 case 'b': {
00110                     printf("%s", *((Bool *)ptr) ? "true" : "false");
00111                     break;
00112                 }
00113                 case 'B': {
00114                     putchar('[');
00115                     for (int i = 0; i < width; ++i) {
00116                         if (mask & (1<<i))
00117                             printf("%s", ((Bool *)ptr)[i] ? "true" : "false");
00118                         else
00119                             printf("_________");
00120                         putchar(i != width-1 ? ',' : ']');
00121                     }
00122                     break;
00123                 }
00124                 case 'i': PRINT_SCALAR("%d", int);
00125                 case 'I': PRINT_VECTOR("%d", int);
00126                 case 'u': PRINT_SCALAR("%u", unsigned int);
00127                 case 'U': PRINT_VECTOR("%u", unsigned int);
00128                 case 'f': PRINT_SCALAR("%f", float);
00129                 case 'F': PRINT_VECTOR("%f", float);
00130                 case 'l': PRINT_SCALAR("%lld", long long);
00131                 case 'L': PRINT_VECTOR("%lld", long long);
00132                 case 'v': PRINT_SCALAR("%llu", unsigned long long);
00133                 case 'V': PRINT_VECTOR("%llu", unsigned long long);
00134                 case 'd': PRINT_SCALAR("%f", double);
00135                 case 'D': PRINT_VECTOR("%f", double);
00136                 default:
00137                     printf("UNKNOWN TYPE ");
00138                     putchar(*types);
00139                 }
00140                 ++types;
00141             }
00142         }
00143         ++format;
00144     }
00145     fflush(stdout);
00146 }

00149 int __num_cores() {
00150 #ifdef _MSC_VER
00151     // This is quite a hack.  Including all of windows.h to get this definition
00152     // pulls in a bunch of stuff that leads to undefined symbols at link time.
00153     // So we don't #include <windows.h> but instead have the equivalent declarations
00154     // here.  Presumably this struct declaration won't be changing in the future
00155     // anyway...
00156     struct SYSTEM_INFO {
00157         int pad0[2];
00158         void *pad1[2];
00159         int *pad2;
00160         int dwNumberOfProcessors;
00161         int pad3[3];
00162     };
00163 
00164     struct SYSTEM_INFO sysInfo;
00165     extern void __stdcall GetSystemInfo(struct SYSTEM_INFO *);
00166     GetSystemInfo(&sysInfo);
00167     return sysInfo.dwNumberOfProcessors;
00168 #else
00169     return sysconf(_SC_NPROCESSORS_ONLN);
00170 #endif // !_MSC_VER
00171 }
